docs.lead_paragraph: Herbalife Ltd would pay $15 million to settle an 18-month battle over a class action lawsuit brought by a former distributor claiming that the nutrition and supplements company is running an alleged pyramid scheme, according to a U.S. court filing.

headline.main: Herbalife to Pay $15 Million to Settle Class Action Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Herbalife to Pay $15 Million to Settle Class Action Lawsuit

docs.snippet: Herbalife Ltd would pay $15 million to settle an 18-month battle over a class action lawsuit brought by a former distributor claiming that the nutrition and supplements company is running an alleged pyramid scheme, according to a U.S. court filing.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government says Gerber is making false claims that its Good Start Gentle baby formula can prevent or reduce allergies in children.

headline.main: U.S. Accuses Gerber of False Claims for Formula
headline.print_headline: U.S. Accuses Gerber of False Claims for Formula

docs.abstract: Federal Trade Commission files suit against Gerber, alleging that baby food maker made false claims that its Good Start Gentle baby formula can prevent or reduce allergies in children.
docs.snippet: The government says Gerber is making false claims that its Good Start Gentle baby formula can prevent or reduce allergies in children.

docs.lead_paragraph: Baby-food maker Gerber is being accused by the government of claiming falsely that its Good Start Gentle formula can prevent or reduce allergies in children.

headline.main: FTC Accuses Gerber of False Claim on Baby Formula
headline.print_headline: FTC Accuses Gerber of False Claim on Baby Formula

docs.snippet: Baby-food maker Gerber is being accused by the government of claiming falsely that its Good Start Gentle formula can prevent or reduce allergies in children.

docs.lead_paragraph: Microsoft is releasing a $199 fitness band that also checks your email and even pays for coffee as the software company seeks to challenge Apple and others in the still-infant market for wearable devices.

headline.main: Microsoft Unveils Fitness Gadget, Health Tracking
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Unveils Fitness Gadget, Health Tracking

docs.snippet: Microsoft is releasing a $199 fitness band that also checks your email and even pays for coffee as the software company seeks to challenge Apple and others in the still-infant market for wearable devices.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you think of Tyler Florence as the cook next door, the guy you can count on for classics like burgers and onion rings, you may be surprised by his latest effort, "Tyler Florence: Inside the Test Kitchen."
docs.snippet: If you think of Tyler Florence as the cook next door, the guy you can count on for classics like burgers and onion rings, you may be surprised by his latest effort, "Tyler Florence: Inside the Test Kitchen."

headline.main: Sports Gels Can Improve Marathon Times, but Pace Them Right

docs.abstract: Many runners in Sunday’s New York City Marathon may be overlooking a simple way to improve their finishing time.
docs.snippet: Many runners in Sunday’s New York City Marathon may be overlooking a simple way to improve their finishing time.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bob Kennedy, 44, a two-time Olympian on the track, has again entered the New York City Marathon, with a twist on the usual trajectory of a runner.

headline.main: New York Marathon 2014: Ex-Distance Star Is Taking It Slower
headline.print_headline: An Ex-Distance Star Is Now Taking It Slower

docs.abstract: Profile of Bob Kennedy, two-time Olympic distance runner, who has entered New York City Marathon after not competing for more than a decade; Kennedy finds himself in unusual position of a once-elite athlete who has finally learned to become an amateur, but says change has allowed him to recover joy that waned during his career.
docs.snippet: Bob Kennedy, 44, a two-time Olympian on the track, has again entered the New York City Marathon, with a twist on the usual trajectory of a runner.

docs.lead_paragraph: Not only are chocolate makers getting more creative with ingredients, they are also experimenting with packaging by embracing “the smorgasbord effect.” (Article plus video.)

headline.main: The Chocolate Halloween Candy in the Trick-or-Treat Bag

docs.abstract: Michael Moss What's In It? column describes the ingredients of and marketing strategy adapted for chocolate Halloween candy found in the trick-or-treat bag.
docs.snippet: Not only are chocolate makers getting more creative with ingredients, they are also experimenting with packaging by embracing “the smorgasbord effect.” (Article plus video.)
